bestBHT.bht: When Jesus fed the five thousand with five loaves and asked his disciples about the fragments they had collected, he was not seeking information, but causing them to reflect on the miracle they had witnessed. By recalling the exact number of baskets full of fragments, their memories were refreshed and they were reminded of the abundance of God's provision. The baskets of fragments were more than double the number of loaves, emphasizing the extravagance of God's work. Surely, this unforgettable event served as a powerful reminder of God's faithfulness and ability to exceed all expectations.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: 19. When I brake the five loaves
John Gill: Their memories were hereby refreshed, and they call to mind the exact number of the baskets of fragments that were taken up." (26 words)
The baskets of fragments that were taken up were above double the number of the loaves, the multitude were fed with." (23 words)
Surely you cannot have forgotten what was so lately done." (11 words)

bhtAttempts.bht: When Jesus fed the five thousand with five loaves and asked his disciples about the fragments they had collected, he was not seeking information, but causing them to reflect on the miracle they had witnessed. By recalling the exact number of baskets full of fragments, their memories were refreshed and they were reminded of the abundance of God's provision. The baskets of fragments were more than double the number of loaves, emphasizing the extravagance of God's work. Surely, this unforgettable event served as a powerful reminder of God's faithfulness and ability to exceed all expectations.

When Jesus multiplied the five loaves among the five thousand, he asked his disciples about the baskets full of fragments they had collected. This was not a genuine inquiry, but a way of provoking their memory and reflection on the miracle that had just occurred. By recalling the exact number of baskets, their memories were refreshed, and they were reminded of the abundance of God's provision, which far exceeded the number of loaves. This unforgettable event was a powerful testament to God's faithfulness and ability to surpass all expectations.

When Jesus fed the five thousand with five loaves, he questioned his disciples about the number of baskets full of fragments they had collected. This was not a genuine inquiry but a means to refresh their memories and prompt reflection on the miracle they had just witnessed. By recalling the exact number of baskets, they were reminded of the abundant provision of God. The baskets of fragments surpassed the quantity of the original loaves, serving as a powerful reminder of God's faithfulness and ability to exceed all expectations.

Jesus, after miraculously multiplying the five loaves among the five thousand, asked his disciples about the number of baskets filled with fragments they had gathered. This question was not intended for information, but served as a reminder for them to recall the exact amount of baskets. The abundance of fragments exceeded the number of original loaves, leaving no room for doubt regarding God's provision. This memorable event showcased God's faithfulness and ability to abundantly exceed human expectations.

When Jesus performed the miracle of feeding the five thousand with five loaves, he questioned his disciples about the number of baskets full of fragments they had collected. This inquiry was not to seek information, but to prompt their memory and reflection on the event. Remembering the exact number of baskets refreshed their minds and reminded them of the abundant provision of God. The quantity of fragments exceeded the number of loaves, emphasizing God's ability to surpass expectations and affirming his faithfulness.
